meanings.definition: Characterized by a desire to attract attention to oneself
meanings.sent1: She always wore bright colors to be exhibitionistic.
meanings.sent2: His exhibitionistic behavior made him the center of attention.
meanings.sent3: The peacock's exhibitionistic display of feathers amazed the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night were like an exhibitionistic spectacle.
meanings.sent5: The singer's exhibitionistic performance captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: Involving a tendency to display one's body or behavior in a showy or ostentatious manner
meanings.sent1: The fashion model's exhibitionistic poses caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's exhibitionistic moves stunned the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat's exhibitionistic grooming routine was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks put on an exhibitionistic show in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist's exhibitionistic paintings were displayed in the gallery.
